definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: One of ecological crises people were facing was land salt- alkalinization.
sentences.chinese: 土壤鹽鹼化是人類面臨的生態危機之一。

sentences.english: High pH of lake water makes phosphorus to be desorbed from suspended particle.
sentences.chinese: 湖水鹼化促進水層中顆粒磷解吸成爲水溶性磷。

sentences.english: A great quantity of soluble inorganic salt can force the surrounding soil seriously become salinization and alkalinization.
sentences.chinese: 大量可溶性無機鹽會加劇周邊土壤的鹽鹼化。

sentences.english: The salinization of soil has already become an important environmental problem limiting the agricultural productivity.
sentences.chinese: 土壤鹽鹼化已經成爲制約農業發展的嚴重問題。

sentences.english: Two stages are recognized for the formation of trona: formation of sodium and alkaline reaction.
sentences.chinese: 天然鹼形成過程包括鈉鹽的形成和鹼化反應。

sentences.english: The traditional method of forecasting soil salinization with developing rate is not precise.
sentences.chinese: 傳統上用發展速率的方法預測鹽鹼化是不嚴謹的。

sentences.english: China is one of the most serious salinization countries.
sentences.chinese: 我國是受土地鹽鹼化危害最嚴重的國家之一。

sentences.english: The salinization of soil is a widespread environmental problem and an important factor in limiting agricultural productivity.
sentences.chinese: 土壤鹽鹼化已經成爲限制世界農業發展的重要因素。
